messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] how-to websites
messages.msgSnippet: Our kids love How its Made , its a half-hour show.  I often hear oh that s how that s made !!  ;)  Its great for all ages. There is also a website for the
messages.messageBody:
Our kids love "How its Made", its a half-hour show. I often hear "oh that's how that's made !!" ;) Its great for all ages.

There is also a website for the show http://www.commentcestfait.com/html/anglais/index2.html

Carol


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] how-to websites
messages.msgSnippet: http://science.howstuffworks.com/lens.htm  for how corrective lens work... ... From: John and Amanda Slater  To:
messages.messageBody:
http://science.howstuffworks.com/lens.htm for how corrective lens work...


----- Original Message ----
From: John and Amanda Slater <fourslaterz@...>
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com; alwaysunschooled@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, October 16, 2006 11:25:44 PM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] how-to websites

My 5 yo ds is always asking me how they make stuff. Today it has been matchbox cars, eye glasses (he just got his first pair today), marshmallows (we looked that up and will try it soon), etc. I was wondering how to find this information. I don't need a history, just a brief video or maybe description (like a Mr. Rodgers' thing). We will be getting netflix in a few weeks if that opens possiblities.

Amanda
Eli 5 Samuel almost 4


------------ --------- --------- ---
